intro: Psoralea psoralioides var. typica, commonly known as the typical psoralea, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its compound leaves with small, rounded leaflets. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, adapting well to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
